info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:53AM CDT until April 5 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Camden, Maries, Miller and Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In southwest Missouri, Dallas and Laclede.
* WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen and an additional half of an inch to 2 inches may occur today. - This includes the following low water crossings... Mountain Creek at Kinfolk Road, Osage Fork at Auburn Road, Dry Fork at County Road 407, Smoky Hollow at Highway J, Osage Fork at Highway J, Maries River at County Road 211 and Wet Glaize at Carrol Cave Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rolla, Fort Leonard Wood, Lebanon, Waynesville, Buffalo, St. Robert, Richland, Dixon, Belle, Crocker, Conway, Iberia, Doolittle, Vienna, Newburg, Morgan, Phillipsburg, Stoutland, Bennett Springs, Twin Bridges, Ozark Springs, Swedeborg, Laquey, Wet Glaize, Dry Knob, Falcon, Devil's Elbow, Sleeper, Jerome, Lynchburg, Brinktown, Competition, Eldridge, Northwye, Vichy, Windyville, Long Lane, Plad, Charity and Bennett Spring State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Camden, MO; Dallas, MO; Laclede, MO; Maries, MO; Miller, MO; Phelps, MO; Pulaski, MO
